channel.title: Just downloaded Ubuntu, trouble with .sh files
channel.description:
I am trying to make a .sh file to run a small java project I've made. Here is what I have:
[code] #!/bin/sh
java Engine.java
[/code]
What do I need to make it run? When I try to open it, nothing happens.
[size=3pt]dun make fun[/size]

item.title: Just downloaded Ubuntu, trouble with .sh files
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

I downloaded eclipse

fuck this shit

item.title: Just downloaded Ubuntu, trouble with .sh files
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Which ubuntu are you using? I’m using 10.04 Lucid, and I have that in my repos. Maverick should too, did you do ‘sudo apt-get update’?

EDIT: I finally get this mother fucker to compile and now it still can’t find my mother fucking Engine class. Here’s my run.sh:

#!/bin/bash
java /home/fabio301/Desktop/project/Engine.java

Read full topic

http://www.ubuntugeek.com/sun-java-moved-to-the-partner-repository-in-ubuntu-10-04-lucid.html
If you aren’t using lucid, plug in the name of what you are using. (maverick maybe?)[/quote]

Did it, still getting the same thing.

Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree

Package sun-java6-jdk is not available, but is referred to by another package.

because you’re trying to execute a source file, compile it first…
[/quote]

EDIT: compiler can’t find my fucking javac

#!/bin/bash cd .. "/home/fabio301/jdk1.6.0_24/bin/javac" -cp . -d ./*.java [/quote]

Why did you download java? Instead of just ‘sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk’ ? (do that instead)
